The formula for calculating power density reference levels at frequencies between 300 MHz and 6 GHz is 0.02619 f (exp 0.6834) - where f is the frequency in MHz.

1  W/m^2 for base station antennas operating in the range 800-2200 MHz. In addition there is a limit for base station antennas of 0.1  W/m^2 in 'sensitive areas' (schools, hospitals, nurseries).
1  W/m^2 for base station antennas operating in the range 800-2200 MHz. In addition there is a limit for base station antennas of 0.1  W/m^2 in 'sensitive areas' (schools, hospitals, nurseries).

The regulation sets limits for power density at 70% of those in the EU Recommendation (ICNIRP 98) (3.15) and 60% when antenna stations are located closer than 300 metres from the property boundaries of schools, kindergartens, hospitals or eldercare facilities (2.7).

The regulation sets limits for power density at 70% of those in the EU Recommendation (ICNIRP 98) (6.3) and 60% when antenna stations are located closer than 300 metres from the property boundaries of schools, kindergartens, hospitals or eldercare facilities (5.4).

The stated value is the maximum  allowed (10% of ICNIRP limit). In addition, it is mandatory for each base station to obtain a specific permit with the minimum exposure possible that enables provision of the needed coverage and capacity.

The stated value is the maximum  allowed (10% of ICNIRP limit). In addition, it is mandatory for each base station to obtain a specific permit with the minimum exposure possible that enables provision of the needed coverage and capacity.

The exposure limit is 1 W/m^2. Moreover, in homes, schools, playgrounds and places where people may stay for longer than 4 hours,  an 'attention value' of 0.1 W/m^2 is applied and averaged over any 24 hour period. A 'quality goal' for new installations is identical to the attention value.
